item.title: Introduction
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery: Lab: https://portswigger.net/web-security/csrf Attacker can Forge HTTP Request of your Website —> Then, Trick User to Click/open (Malicious Script or page) link —> Do, Unintended Action (Change Email, PWD, Transfer Fund, Gain Full Control over User Account) Allow Attacker Move Same Origin Policy: which prevent Different Website from interfering with each other: ![[cross-site request forgery.svg]] Most IMPORTAINT: CSRF Attack be Possible; 3 Condition Must Meet: Relevant Action: Reason for attack the Victim (Gain Privileged User, Change User PWD or Email) Cookie-based Session Handling: Session Cookie identify user —-> Any Other Mechanism (Tracking Session or Validate user Request) Won’t Work No Unpredictable Request Parameters: All the Parameter Need to Stay the Same Ex: Request: Host: vulnerable-website.
